column12: Procedimiento de moldeo por inyección multicapa y de moldeo por soplado
column13: Proceso de moldeo por inyección superpuesta y soplado que comprende las siguientes etapas: a. inyección de la preforma (4) desde una unidad auxiliar de inyección adyacente al molde y desplazamiento del material procesado desde la unidad auxiliar de inyección al molde a través del canal de alimentación de la primera inyección (2), que está introducido en la placa de la cavidad (1) y en la cavidad (3): b. enfriamiento del material inyectado y apertura del molde por la línea de partición (11); c. alineación de la preforma (4) en la cavidad (17) de la segunda inyección y los elementos móviles (18 y 24); d. cierre del molde en la cavidad (17) de la segunda inyección y accionamiento del sistema mecánico de rampa (8) desde el dispositivo de accionamiento (25); e. movimiento ascendente de la válvula tubular (9), que abre el canal de gas (14) y establece contacto entre el canal de gas (14) y la preforma (4); f. inyección de gas desde un sistema de inyección de gas al canal de gas (14) y control de la presión del gas; g. soplado de la preforma (4); h. enfriamiento de la preforma soplada (21) cerca de las superficies de los elementos móviles (18, 24) en donde se mantiene la presión de soplado; i. descompresión del gas que sale de la cámara (22) de gas presurizado al exterior del molde accionando la válvula de aire; j. enfriamiento del segundo componente; k. apertura del molde por la línea de partición (11) y extracción de la pieza desde el tapón (6); y caracterizado por - el soplado de la preforma (4) en la etapa g. y la inyección simultánea del segundo componente (23), a través de una unidad de inyección que desplaza el material procesado en la unidad de inyección al espacio (19) de la segunda inyección a través del canal de alimentación de la segunda inyección (16), transformando adicionalmente la preforma (4) en la preforma soplada (21); - el enfriamiento del segundo componente en la etapa j. utilizando circuitos de refrigeración instalados en el molde, y la solidificación del material inyectado para formar el segundo componente (23); - la unidad de inyección del segundo componente (23) es la misma que la unidad de inyección de la preforma cuando el material utilizado para la inyección de la preforma (4) es el mismo que el utilizado para la inyección del segundo componente.

column12: PROCESSO DE MOLDAÇÃO POR INJEÇÃO SOBREPOSTA E INSUFLAÇÃO
column13: A PRESENTE INVENÇÃO DIZ RESPEITO A UM PROCESSO DE MOLDAÇÃO POR INJEÇÃO SOBREPOSTA E INSUFLAÇÃO E INSERE-SE NA ÁREA DA ENGENHARIA MECÂNICA APLICADA AO PROCESSAMENTO DE MATERIAIS POLIMÉRICOS TERMOPLÁSTICOS. O MÉTODO PRECONIZADO PERMITE A COMBINAÇÃO DA MOLDAÇÃO POR INJEÇÃO SOBREPOSTA COM A MOLDAÇÃO POR INSUFLAÇÃO. A INJEÇÃO DO MATERIAL QUE SE SOBREPÕE PODERÁ OCORRER ANTERIORMENTE, SIMULTANEAMENTE OU POSTERIORMENTE AO PROCESSO DE INSUFLAÇÃO. A COMBINAÇÃO DESTES DOIS PROCESSOS PERMITE OBTER UMA PEÇA CONSTITUÍDA POR UMA OU MAIS MATÉRIAS-PRIMAS TERMOPLÁSTICAS DE MATRIZ POLIMERICA, RETIRANDO PARTIDO SIMULTANEAMENTE DE CADA UM DOS PROCESSOS. ESTE MÉTODO PODE OCORRER COM RECURSO A APENAS UM MOLDE, POSSIBILITANDO A PRODUÇÃO DE PEÇAS COM CARACTERÍSTICAS DE CADA UM DOS PROCESSOS EM APENAS UM CICLO DE MOLDAÇÃO. PERMITE IGUALMENTE A OBTENÇÃO DE PEÇAS PLÁSTICAS COMBINANDO AS CARACTERÍSTICAS DE CADA UM DOS PROCESSOS. A MATÉRIA-PRIMA UTILIZADA NA SEGUNDA INJEÇÃO PODERÁ SER IGUAL Á MATÉRIA-PRIMA UTILIZADA NA PRIMEIRA INJEÇÃO, SENDO QUE TAMBÉM PODERÁ SER DIFERENTE, PROPORCIONANDO COR OU CARACTERISTICAS FISICAS DIFERENCIADAS AO PRODUTO FINAL.

column12: MULTILAYER INJECTION-MOULDING AND BLOW-MOULDING METHOD
column13: The present invention relates to a molding process by superimposed injection and blowing regarding the field of mechanical engineering applied to the processing of thermoplastic polymer materials. The proposed process allows the combination of injection molding superimposed with blowing molding. The injection of superimposed material may occur before, simultaneously, or after the blowing process. Combining these two processes allows obtaining a piece consisting in one or more thermoplastic raw materials of polymer matrix, taking advantage of each process at the same time. This process can be carried out using only a mould, allowing the production of pieces with characteristics of each of the processes in a single molding cycle. It also allows obtaining plastic pieces combining the features of each process. The raw material used for the second injection may be equal to the raw material used in the first injection, but may also be different providing different color or other physical distinctive characteristics to the final product.

column12: METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR MEDIA CHANNEL FORMAT SET MANAGEMENT IN OPTICAL TRANSPORT NETWORKS
column13: The present invention discloses a method of determining a set of media channel (MCh) widths to be used in an optical network, comprising the following steps: based on the topology of the network, computing a first set of MCh widths for tentative use in said optical network, said first set of MCh width defining a target spectral efficiency, and generating a reduced set of MCh widths from said firstset of MCh widths by mapping each of the original MCh widths of said first set to a corresponding new MCh width, which is identical with or larger than the original MCh width. The mapping is carriedout automatically using a width adjustment module (18) module employing an optimization algorithm that penalizes MCh widths that are more likely to cause fragmentation problems in the spectrum as compared to MCh widths that are less likely to cause fragmentation problems, and penalizes a decrease in spectral width as compared to the target spectral efficiency due to the mapping of an original MChwidth of said first set to a new, larger width.
column15: EIRA ANTONIO;;JOAO MANUEL FERREIRA PEDRO

column12: CRAYFORD FOCUSER FOR ASTRONOMICAL TELESCOPES
column13: A Crayford focuser includes a body member having an inner wall defining a central channel. A first bearing holding structure extends outward from the inner wall and is open to the central channel at one end. A second bearing holding structure extends outward from the inner wall and is open to the central channel at one end. First and second bearing rails are removably held by the first bearing holding structure and the second bearing holding structure, respectively.

column12: Method and system for assigning resources in optical transport networks
column13: The proposed invention is in the area of managing resources in optical transport networks, for example in the area of in-operation media channel format and spectrum management. For this purpose, the type of Media Channel Format is determined for each of a plurality of candidate paths, wherein each candidate path connects a pair of nodes in an optical transport network. Then, the expected weight describing traffic volume of each of the candidate paths is determined, and a spectrum share is assigned to each link of each of the candidate paths based on the determined Media Channel Formats and determined weights. In this way, spectrum shares assigned to different links and candidate paths can be used for efficiently assigning a band spectrum to each of the Media Channel Formats of the candidate paths.
column15: EIRA ANTONIO;;FERREIRA PEDRO JOÃO MANUEL
column32: Eira, A. et al., “On the Impact of Optimized Guard-Band Assignment for Superchannels in Flexible-Grid Optical Networks,” OFC/NFOEC Technical Digest, OTu2A.5, 3 pages (2013).;;International Search Report and Written Opinion, PCT/EP2017/079849 , dated Feb. 20, 2018, 15 pages.;;Klinkowski, M. et al., “Elastic Spectrum Allocation for Time-Varying Traffic in FlexGrid Optical Networks,” IEEE Journal On Selected Areas In Communication, vol. 31(1):26-38 (2013).;;Sugihara, S. et al., “Routing and Spectrum Allocation Method for Immediate Reservation and Advance Reservation Requests in Elastic Optical Networks,” Photonics in Switching, Optical Networking (Topic 4), IEEE: 178-180 (2015).;;Wang, X. et al., “Blocking Probability and Fairness in Two-Rate Elastic Optical Networks,” IEEE, ICTON: TH.B3.2: 4 pages (2014).;;Zhang, J. et al., “Dynamic Traffic Grooming in Sliceable Bandwidth-Variable Transponder-Enabled Elastic Optical Networks,” Journal of Lightwave Technology, vol. 33(1) 183-191 (2015).

column12: SISTEMA E PROCESSO DE RECUPERAÇÃO DE VAPORES E MÓDULO DE CONDENSAÇÃO PARA OS MESMOS
column13: SISTEMA E PROCESSO DE RECUPERAÇÃO DE VAPORES E MÓDULO DE CONDENSAÇÃO PARA OS MESMOS. A presente invenção refere-se a um sistema recuperador de vapores que adota pelo menos um módulo de condensação (5) e pelo menos um módulo de refrigeração (13), em que o módulo de condensação compreende trocador de calor de duplos tubos com eixo dotado de aletas intermitentes. É ainda fornecido na saída do módulo um separador vapor/líquido (14) compreendendo chapas separadoras (22, 23) contendo orifícios (24) para separação vapor/líquido, e ainda um sifão (16) na saída de condensado (15). É prevista a instalação de um trocador de calor de fluxo cruzado (45) na entrada de vapor (1) do módulo de condensação (5), em que o vapor refrigerante é o vapor proveniente de um separador vapor/líquido (14) instalado na saída de mistura de vapor e líquido (2) do módulo de condensação (5). Vantagens da presente invenção incluem aumento do tempo de permanência dos vapores no interior do módulo de condensação, garantia de que somente o condensado é direcionado ao tanque de armazenamento de produto recuperado e reaproveitamento térmico de vapores.
column15: DANTE BELLINI;;MANUEL DA COSTA FERREIRA

For this purpose, the type of Media Channel Format is determined for each of a plurality of candidate paths, wherein each candidate path connects a pair of nodes in an optical transport network. Then, the expected weight describing traffic volume of each of the candidate paths is determined, and a spectrum share is assigned to each link of each of the candidate paths based on the determined Media Channel Formats and determined weights. column12: Method and system for media channel format set management in optical transport networks
column13: A set of media channel (MCh) widths is determined for an optical network. Based on a topology of the network, a first set of original MCh widths are computed for tentative use in the optical network, the first set of original MCh widths defining a target spectral efficiency. A reduced set of new MCh widths are generated from the first set of MCh widths by respectively mapping each of the original MCh widths of the first set of original MCh widths to a corresponding, or respective, new MCh width. An optimization algorithm is used in an example embodiment to facilitate the mapping.

column12: File for sheets of paper, especially for sheets of EDP paper
column13: A file is provided for sheets (30) of paper, especially for sheets of EDP paper, which have a row of punched holes (31) at equal distances apart on each of their two lateral edges, a flat support (20) and two retainers (40) arranged on the support (20) with clips (70) for receiving and fixing the sheets (30) of paper being provided. The retainers (40) are fixed on the supports (20) by their clips (70) at a predetermined distance apart and on the lines of the two rows (32) of punched holes (31) in the sheets (30) of paper. column12: Gutter cleaning device
column13: A gutter cleaning device adapted to remove leaves and other debris from household gutters is disclosed in which a generally flat blade-like working head is connected to an elongated hollow handle. Fluid, such as water from a garden hose, is directed through the handle and into the working head whereupon it exits through a plurality of discharge openings provided in each of the sidewalls in part forming the head so as to direct a plurality of streams along the inside surface of the gutter. The device may be moved back and forth or in one direction along the gutter and in this way the fluid stream serves to loosen and/or force leaves and debris in front of the working head to accordingly enable the gutters to be so cleaned.

column12: METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR MEDIA CHANNEL FORMAT SET MANAGEMENT IN OPTICAL TRANSPORT NETWORKS
column13: A set of media channel (MCh) widths are determined to be used in an optical network. Based on the topology of the network, a first set of MCh widths are computed for tentative use in said optical network, said first set of MCh width defining a target spectral efficiency. A reduced set of MCh widths are generated from said first set of MCh widths by mapping each of the original MCh widths of said first set to a corresponding new MCh width, which is identical with or larger than the original MCh width. An optimization algorithm is used that penalizes MCh widths that are more likely to cause fragmentation problems in the spectrum, and penalizes a decrease in spectral width due to the mapping of an original MCh width of said first set to a new, larger width.

column12: A golf bag stand
column13: A golf bag accessory is provided for supporting a golf bag in an upright configuration. The accessory is mounted beneath the base member of a golf bag and includes blade-like elements 16 that are displaceable between an inoperative position in which they are disposed substantially entirely within the outer perimeter of the base member of the bag and an operative position in which they extend radially beyond the outer perimeter of the base member of the bag. In this operative position the blade-like elements effectively enlarge the diameter of the base member and thereby render the bag self-supporting in its upright configuration. When the bag is placed on the ground rotation relative to the ground-engaging base causes extension of the elements 16. <IMAGE>

column12: Switch actuator mechanism
column13: A switch actuator mechanism, for example for use with a circuit breaker, includes a rocker which has first and second rocker members which are hinged together. The rocker members have flat front faces which are movable between a condition in which they lie flat in the same plane, and a second position in which the faces are inclined relative to one another, with one rocker member standing proud of the housing of the switch or circuit breaker. Fingers on one of the rocker members engage a link of the circuit breaker mechanism to open or close its contacts. A spring loaded latching mechanism locks the rocker members alternately in their first and second conditions with successive operations of the mechanism.

column12: Apparatus for making three-dimensional articles including moving build material reservoir and associated method
column13: A three-dimensional article making apparatus includes a first positioner for positioning a build material jetting head along a first direction, a second positioner for positioning the first positioner along a second direction so that the jetting head is effectively positionable along the second direction as well, and a build material reservoir being mounted on the first positioner so that a flexible connecting tube need only flex to accommodate positioning of jetting head along the first direction but not along the second direction. The jetting head may be a piezoelectric jet which operates by forming a negative meniscus at an orifice of jet between droplets. Accordingly, the build material reservoir may be mounted vertically relative to the piezoelectric jet to form the negative meniscus by negative head pressure. The apparatus preferably includes a solid build material supply mounted on an apparatus frame for storing build material in solid form. The first and second positioners may be used for selectively positioning the build material reservoir adjacent the solid build material supply to replenish build material within the build material reservoir. In addition, a build material level sensor may be provided for initiating replenishment of the build material reservoir responsive to a low level of build material. Related methods are also disclosed.

column12: URNA FUNERÁRIA DESMONTÁVEL NUMA CONFIGURAÇÃO COMPACTA PARA TRANSPORTE
column13: A INVENÇÃO DIZ RESPEITO A URNA FUNERÁRIA DESMONTÁVEL NUMA CONFIGURAÇÃO COMPACTA PARA TRANSPORTE COMPREENDENDO: UMA TAMPA (1); UM FUNDO; UM PAR DE PAREDES LATERAIS LONGITUDINAIS (3); UM PAR DE PAREDES LATERAIS TRANSVERSAIS (4), EM QUE OS DIFERENTES COMPONENTES SÃO CONECTADOS ATRAVÉS DE ENCAIXES DOS BORDOS DAS ILHARGAS COM SULCOS DISPOSTOS PERIFERICAMENTE NA TAMPA E NO FUNDO, ATRAVÉS DE ENCAIXES ENTRE FENDAS VERTICAIS NAS ILHARGAS E POR MEIOS DE FIXAÇÃO (11). A INVENÇÃO RESOLVE OS PROBLEMAS RELACIONADOS À NECESSIDADE DE DESENVOLVER URNA FUNERÁRIA DESMONTÁVEL NUMA CONFIGURAÇÃO COMPACTA PARA TRANSPORTE, EM QUE OS SEUS COMPONENTES PODEM SER CONECTADOS DE UM MODO SIMPLES E PRÁTICO, SEM QUE SEJAM NECESSÁRIOS MÉTODOS COMPLEXOS DE MONTAGEM OU UMA PLURALIDADE DE FERRAMENTAS. A INVENÇÃO TAMBÉM INTEGRA A PRATICIDADE DE MONTAGEM E DESMONTAGEM À RESISTÊNCIA ACOMODAR E TRANSPORTAR COM SEGURANÇA UM CORPO NA URNA FUNERÁRIA.

column12: Method for associating an image-forming device, a mobile device, and a user
column13: Systems, methods, and devices for associating an image forming device and a mobile device receive, at a first device, a request to establish a connection with a second device; generating an optically-readable code that encodes a first set of data, wherein the first set of data includes first key-derivation data; display the optically-readable code of the first set of data; establish a communication channel with the second device; receiving a second set of data from the second device via the established communication channel, wherein the second set of data includes second key-derivation data, and wherein the second key-derivation data is generated in response to receiving the first key-derivation data at the second device; and determine the common key from the first key-derivation data and the second key-derivation data.

column12: APPARATUS FOR MAKING THREE-DIMENSIONAL ARTICLES INCLUDING MOVING BUILD MATERIAL RESERVOIR AND ASSOCIATED METHOD
column13: A three-dimensional article making apparatus includes a first positioner (71) for positioning a build material jetting head (34) along a first direction, a second positioner (69) for positioning the first positioner (71) along a second direction so that the jetting head (34) is effectively positionable along the second direction as well, and a build material reservoir (78) being mounted on the first positioner (71) so that a flexible connecting tube (72) need only flex to accommodate positoning of jetting head (34) along the first direction but not along the second direction. The jetting head (34) may be a piezoelectric jet which operates by forming a negative meniscus at an orifice of jet between droplets. Accordingly, the build material reservoir (78) may be mounted vertically relative to the piezoelectric jet to form the negative meniscus by negative head pressure. The apparatus preferably includes a solid build material supply (100) mounted on an apparatus frame (31) for storing build material in solid form. The first and second positioners (71, 69) may be used for selectively positioning the build material reservoir (78) adjacent the solid build material supply (100) to replenish build material within the build material reservoir. In addition, a build material level sensor (106) may be provided for initiating replenishment of the build material reservoir (78) responsive to a low level of build material. Related methods are also disclosed.

column12: Switch actuator mechanism
column13: A switch actuator mechanism, for example for use with a circuit breaker, includes a rocker which has first and second rocker members which are hinged together. The rocker members have flat front faces which are movable between a condition in which they lie flat in the same plane, and a second position in which the faces are inclined relative to one another, with one rocker member standing proud of the housing of the switch or circuit breaker. Fingers on one of the rocker members engage a link of the circuit breaker mechanism to open or close its contacts. A spring loaded latching mechanism locks the rocker members alternately in their first and second conditions with successive operations of the mechanism.

column12: mesa de trabalho portátil multiusuário com equipamentos de informática integrados
column13: MESA DE TRABALHO PORTáTIL MULTIUSUáRIO COM EQUIPAMENTOS DE INFORMáTICA INTEGRADOS constitui-se de uma mesa de trabalho conjugada com corpo de instalação de equipamentos de informática e um sistema de monitoramento e controle à distância, dobrável e transportável de forma a acondicionar de forma segura os equipamentos, tornando sua instalação ágil e simples, e possibilitando sua utilização simultânea, interativa e com ergonomia por múltiplos usuários, inclusive portadores de necessidades especiais; solucionando através de um único conjunto limitações ao transporte, ao acondicionamento e proteção aos equipamentos de informática, ao número de possíveis usuários e simultaneidade na sua utilização, e reduzindo custos de manutenção através da solução de monitoramento à distância. O equipamento pode contar com quatro estações de trabalho giratórias para acomodar periféricos de informática tipo computador de mesa (2) ou computadores portáteis (4) de forma a que possam utilizadas por até três usuários por estação, em sua configuração de utilização ideal.

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR OPTIMIZING CODE FOR FIELD PROGRAMMABLE GATE ARRAYS
column13: A method for the generation of a hardware accelerator (20) is described. The method comprises inputting (110) a program (105) with a plurality of lines of code describing an algorithm to be implemented on the hardware accelerator (20) and generating (125) a dataflow graph in memory from the inputted program (105). The dataflow graph is optimized and an output program (140) created from the dataflow graph is output. The output program (140) is then provided to a high-level synthesis tool for generating the hardware accelerator (20).

column12: SYSTEM FOR DETECTING AND LOCATING WATER IN A SANDWICH-TYPE STRUCTURE FOR AIRCRAFTS
column13: L'invention concerne un système de détection et de localisation d'eau dans une structure sandwich (1) pour aéronef, comportant un moyen pour chauffer l'eau présente dans une couche intermédiaire de la structure sandwich et un moyen pour prendre au moins une image d'une surface de la structure sandwich, ladite image montrant des zones remarquables de ladite surface correspondant à la présence d'eau dans la couche intermédiaire, dans lequel le moyen pour chauffer l'eau comporte un dispositif (2, 3, 6) pour émettre, à l'intérieur de la structure sandwich, des micro-ondes à une fréquence sensiblement égale à la fréquence de résonance des molécules d'eau. L'invention concerne aussi un procédé mis en AEuvre par ce système.
column15: FERREIRA DOS SANTOS FERNANDO MANUEL;;ARNAUD JEAN-LOUIS

column12: UTILIZAÇÃO DE UM MEIO GASOSO E APARELHO ELÉTRICO DE MÉDIA TENSÃO
column13: "MISTURA DE HIDROFLUORO OLEFINA E DE HIDROFLUORO CARBONETO PARA MELHORAR A MANUTENÇÃO COM ARCO INTERNO NOS APARELHOS ELÉTRICOS DE MÉDIA E ALTA-TENSÃO". A presente invenção refere-se à utilização de uma mistura, compreendendo uma hidrofluoro olefina e um hidrofluoro carboneto, eventualmente associados a um outro gás fluorado e a um gás de diluição como meio de isolamento elétrico e/ou de extinção dos arcos elétricos em um aparelho elétrico de média tensão. A invenção refere-se também a um aparelho elétrico de média ou alta tensão, no qual o isolamento elétrico e/ou a extinção dos arcos elétricos é (são) assegurada (os) por essa mistura.

column12: SYSTEM FOR SOFTWARE TESTING AND MONITORING AT A PLURALITY OF MOBILE DEVICES FOR ENSURING COMPATIBILITY WITH A DIVERSE SET OF MOBILE DEVICE CONFIGURATIONS AND VARIABLE EXECUTION CONDITIONS
column13: System and method for software testing and monitoring at a plurality of mobile devices for ensuring compatibility with a diverse set of mobile device configurations with software tests, wherein a mobile device configuration is a set of mobile device characteristics, wherein each software test requires a specific set of mobile device characteristics, wherein said plurality of mobile devices are separated into a plurality of mobile device test sets, each said mobile device test set being able to come and leave online availability for testing, said system comprising: a test deployment and scheduling node; a plurality of test set handler nodes connected to the test deployment and scheduling node, each handler node for handling and connecting to one, and only one, mobile device test set; the test deployment and scheduling node being configured for, through the handler nodes: register a mobile device test set when said mobile device test set comes into availability; unregister said mobile device test set when the mobile device test set leaves availability; probabilistically schedule the software tests according to present and past online availability of each mobile device characteristic, and according to the sets of mobile device characteristics required by the software tests; deploy the software tests as scheduled and as the mobile device test sets are available.
column15: ANDRADE BARREIRA RUI MANUEL;;RODRIGUES FERREIRA NUNO FILIPE

column12: MIXTURE OF A HYDROFLUOROOLEFIN AND HYDROFLUOROCARBON FOR IMPROVING INTERNAL ARC RESISTANCE IN MEDIUM- AND HIGH-VOLTAGE ELECTRICAL APPARATUSES
column13: The invention relates to the use of a mixture including a hydrofluoroolefin and a hydrofluorocarbon, optionally combined with another fluorinated gas and a dilution gas, as an electrical insulation medium and/or an electric-arc extinguishing medium in a medium-voltage electrical apparatus. The invention also relates to a medium- or high-voltage electrical apparatus in which such a mixture provides electrical insulation and/or electric-arc extinguishing.
column15: PICCOZ DANIEL;;MALADEN ROMAIN;;FERREIRA DA COSTA MANUEL

column12: Dressing Tool and Method for the Production Thereof
column13: Dressing tool which has profiled elements arranged coaxially with one another and which are each provided with a profile form, which is tapered or the like in its axial cross-section and has working surfaces provided with hard-material particles. The profiled elements are delimited at their outer circumference by at least one generated surface. The dressing tool preferably includes six profiled elements arranged coaxially with one another, and a one-part or two-part metallic main body for the entire dressing tool or for a particular generated surface. The profile forms with the hard-material particles of the profiled elements may be produced by a negative process with a casting compound applied to the particular main body. This dressing tool can thus be used for a profiling of grinding worms extremely productively and precisely and also such that they can be corrected.

column12: DRESSING TOOL AND METHOD FOR THE PRODUCTION THEREOF
column13: The invention relates to a dressing tool which has profiled elements (11.1, 11.2, 12.1, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4) which are arranged coaxially with one another and which are each provided with a profile form, which is tapered or the like in its axial cross-section and has working surfaces (13, 14) which are provided with hard-material particles. The profiled elements (11.1, 11.2, 12.1, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4) are delimited at their outer circumference by at least one generated surface (23, 24). The dressing tool (10) comprises six profiled elements (11.1, 11.2, 12.1, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4) arranged coaxially with one another and a one-part or two-part metallic main body (19) for the entire dressing tool (10) or for a particular generated surface (23, 24). The profile forms with the hard-material particles of the profiled elements (11.1, 11.2, 12.1, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4) are produced here by a negative process with a casting compound (15) applied to the particular main body (19). This dressing tool can thus be used for a profiling of grinding worms extremely productively and precisely and also such that they can be corrected.

column12: Method and apparatus for optimizing code for field programmable gate arrays
column13: A method for the generation of a hardware accelerator ( 20 ) is described. The method comprises inputting ( 110 ) a program ( 105 ) with a plurality of lines of code describing an algorithm to be implemented on the hardware accelerator ( 20 ) and generating ( 125 ) a dataflow graph in memory from the inputted program ( 105 ). The dataflow graph is optimized and an output program ( 140 ) created from the dataflow graph is output. The output program ( 140 ) is then provided to a high-level synthesis tool for generating the hardware accelerator ( 20 ).

column12: Abrichtwerkzeug sowie ein Verfahren zum Auftragen von Hartstoffpartikeln.
column13: Ein Abrichtwerkzeug weist koaxial zueinander angeordnete Profile (11.1, 11.2, 12.1, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4) mit je einer im Achsquerschnitt kegeligen oder Zylindrischen Profilform mit Arbeitsflächen (13, 14) auf, welche mit Hartstoffpartikeln versehen sind. Die Profile (11.1, 11.2, 12.1, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4) sind am Aussenumfang durch wenigstens eine Manteltelfläche (23, 24) begrenzt. Das Abrichtwerkzeug (10) umfasst zwei bis insbesondere sechs koaxial zueinander angeordnete Profile (11.1, 11.2, 12.1, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4) und einen ein- bzw. zweiteiligen metallischen Grundkörper (19) für das gesamte Abrichtwerkzeug (10) oder für eine jeweilige Mantelfläche (23, 24). Die Profilformen mit den Hartstoffpartikeln der Profile (11.1, 11.2, 12.1, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4) sind dabei durch ein Negativverfahren mit einer auf dem jeweiligen Grundkörper (19) aufgebrachten Gussmasse (15) erzeugt. Damit können mit diesem Abrichtwerkzeug Schleifschnecken höchst produktiv, präzise und auch korrigierbar profiliert werden.

column12: MECHANICAL TRACKING MOUNT
column13: A tracking mount for an astronomical equipment includes castellations in a semicircular arrangement at a first end of a base member. The base member has a through hole formed at a radial center of the castellations. Additionally, the tracking mount includes a tracking arm having a shaft extending perpendicular to a long axis of the tracking arm and a set of teeth formed at a position distal to the shaft. The shaft has a notch formed at an end opposite the tracking arm. The shaft is dimensioned to be inserted into the through hole. A coil torsion spring having a crossbar formed at one end is mated with the notch on the shaft. A selector structure formed at another end of the torsion spring is dimensioned to sit within a castellation of the plurality of castellations. Adjusting the position of the selector structure relative to the plurality castellations adjusts the torsion coefficient of the coil torsion spring.
column15: FERREIRA DA SILVA PEREIRA PEDRO MANUEL;;FATTINNANZI CHRISTIAN

column13: The invention relates to the use of a mixture of a hydrofluoroolefin and a hydrofluorocarbon, optionally combined with another fluorinated gas, as an electrical insulation medium and/or an electric arc extinguishing medium in a medium-voltage electrical apparatus. column12: MÉTODO DE INTERAÇÃO PARA CONTEÚDOS REMOTOS EM MOLDURAS DIGITAIS
column13: ESTA INVENÇÃO CONSISTE NUM MÉTODO QUE PERMITE INTERAÇÃO ARBITRÁRIA COM CONTEÚDO REMOTO, EXIBIDO NA MOLDURA DIGITAL, USANDO APENAS OS BOTÕES DE AVANÇAR E RECUAR DISPONÍVEIS NA GENERALIDADE DAS MOLDURAS DIGITAIS EXISTENTES NO MERCADO.ESTA INVENÇÃO PERMITE AUMENTAR O NÚMERO POTENCIAL DE FUNÇÕES DE UMA MOLDURA DIGITAL COMO DISPOSITIVO GENÉRICO DE INTERAÇÃO COM CONTEÚDOS PERSONALIZADOS. NAS MOLDURAS DIGITAIS COM LIGAÇÃO À REDE, AS IMAGENS EXIBIDAS PODEM SER OBTIDAS A PARTIR DE UM QUALQUER SERVIÇO REMOTO E NÃO PRECISAM DE SER NECESSARIAMENTE FOTOGRAFIAS. COM UM SERVIÇO DE GESTÃO DE CONTEÚDOS ADEQUADO, PODE-SE GERAR DINAMICAMENTE A SEQUÊNCIA DE IMAGENS QUE SE PRETENDA E CADA IMAGEM PODE TER UM QUALQUER TIPO DE INFORMAÇÃO QUE SEJA RELEVANTE PARA O MOMENTO, TRANSFORMANDO ASSIM A MOLDURA DE FOTOGRAFIAS DIGITAL NUM DISPOSITIVO GENÉRICO DE APRESENTAÇÃO DE INFORMAÇÃO PERSONALIZADA. ESTA INVENÇÃO PERMITE ATRIBUIR NOVAS SEMÂNTICAS DE CONTROLO DA APRESENTAÇÃO E SELEÇÃO DE CONTEÚDOS AOS COMANDOS DA MOLDURA DIGITAL.

column12: System for detecting and locating water in a sandwich-type structure for aircrafts
column13: A system for detecting and locating water in a sandwich-type structure for aircrafts, the system including means for heating the water contained in an intermediate layer of the sandwich-type structure, and means for recording at least one image of a surface of the sandwich-type structure, the image showing particular regions of the surface, corresponding to the presence of water in the intermediate layer. The means for heating the water include a device for emitting microwaves inside the sandwich-type structure, at a frequency essentially equal to the resonance frequency of the water molecules. The invention also relates to a method implemented by the system.
column14: DOS SANTOS FERNANDO MANUEL FERREIRA;;ARNAUD JEAN-LOUIS;;AIRBUS OPERATIONS SAS
column15: DOS SANTOS FERNANDO MANUEL FERREIRA;;ARNAUD JEAN-LOUIS

column12: Polymer combinations to improve fragrance longevity
column13: Polymer combinations may be incorporated in a hydroalcoholic solution to improve fragrance longevity. The polymer combination may include at least one plant-based hydrophobic polymer, a hydrophilic polymer, a third cosmetically acceptable sensory polymer, and a fragrance oil in hydroalcoholic solution having prolonged fragrance intensity. The tri-polymer combination may synergistically create a film mesh on the surface of the skin that locks in the fragrance ingredients. The combination may provide an unexpected film forming property with the fragrance oil in hydroalcoholic solution, thereby providing a thin film matrix and adhesive power for the fragrance ingredients to attach/remain on the skin.
column15: LI GENG;;FERREIRA JAIME MANUEL;;DRUCKER NATALIE M

column12: Mixture of a hydrofluoroolefin and hydrofluorocarbon for improving internal arc resistance in medium- and high-voltage electrical apparatuses
column13: The invention relates to the use of a mixture including a hydrofluoroolefin and a hydrofluorocarbon, optionally combined with another fluorinated gas and a dilution gas, as an electrical insulation medium and/or an electric-arc extinguishing medium in a medium-voltage electrical apparatus. The invention also relates to a medium- or high-voltage electrical apparatus in which such a mixture provides electrical insulation and/or electric-arc extinguishing.

column12: DRESSING TOOL AND METHOD FOR THE PRODUCTION THEREOF.
column13: The invention relates to a dressing tool which has profiled elements (11.1, 11.2, 12.1, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4) which are arranged coaxially with one another and which are each provided with a profile form, which is tapered or the like in its axial cross-section and has working surfaces (13, 14) which are provided with hard-material particles. The profiled elements (11.1, 11.2, 12.1, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4) are delimited at their outer circumference by at least one generated surface (23, 24). The dressing tool (10) comprises six profiled elements (11.1, 11.2, 12.1, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4) arranged coaxially with one another and a one-part or two-part metallic main body (19) for the entire dressing tool (10) or for a particular generated surface (23, 24). The profile forms with the hard-material particles of the profiled elements (11.1, 11.2, 12.1, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4) are produced here by a negative process with a casting compound (15) applied to the particular main body (19). This dressing tool can thus be used for a profiling of grinding worms extremely productively and precisely and also such that they can be corrected.
column15: PAVLOVIC MARIN;;MONTEIRO FERREIRA SERGIO MANUEL;;RUDOLF CHRISTOPH

column12: FRAGRANCE COMPOSITIONS

The fragrance composition comprises one or more fragrance ingredients, at least one solubilizer, and acceptable carriers, and the composition is substantially free of ethanol. The composition is a perfume, perfume water, eau de toilette, eau de cologne, eau de parfum, fragrance mist, or air freshener. The composition may be personalized and may also provide a sensory experience.

column12: APPARATUS FOR SYNTHETISING TIN DIOXIDE NANOPARTICLES AND METHOD FOR PRODUCING TIN DIOXIDE NANOPARTICLES
column13: The present application relates to an apparatus and a method for producing tin dioxide nanoparticles on the basis of a reaction between tin tetrachloride and water in the vapour phase. The apparatus comprises a tubular reactor with small holes around the circumference thereof, fed with a water vapour stream perpendicular to the stream of tin tetrachloride that flows through the reactor, enhancing reaction kinetics and yield, and allowing the reaction to be performed at lower temperatures than in other synthesis methods.

column12: MECHANICAL TRACKING MOUNT
column13: A tracking mount (102) for an astronomical equipment includes castellations (226) in a semicircular arrangement at a first end of a base member (114) having a through hole (214) formed at a radial center of the castellations. Additionally, the tracking mount includes a tracking arm (112) having a shaft extending perpendicular to a long axis of the tracking arm and a set of teeth (508) formed at a position distal to the shaft. The shaft has a notch (210) formed at an end opposite the tracking arm. The shaft is dimensioned to be inserted into the through hole. A coil torsion spring (218) having a crossbar (220) formed at one end is mated with the notch on the shaft. A selector structure (224) formed at another end of the torsion spring is dimensioned to sit within a castellation of the plurality of castellations to adjust the torsion coefficient.

column12: POLYMER COMBINATIONS TO IMPROVE FRAGRANCE LONGEVITY
column13: Polymer combinations may be incorporated in a hydroalcoholic solution to improve fragrance longevity. The polymer combination may include at least one plant-based hydrophobic polymer, a hydrophilic polymer, a third cosmetically acceptable sensory polymer, and a fragrance oil in hydroalcoholic solution having prolonged fragrance intensity. The tri-polymer combination may synergistically create a film mesh on the surface of the skin that locks in the fragrance ingredients. The combination may provide an unexpected film forming property with the fragrance oil in hydroalcoholic solution, thereby providing a thin film matrix and adhesive power for the fragrance ingredients to attach/remain on the skin.

column12: mistura de hidrofluoro olefina e de hidrofluoro carboneto para melhorar a manutenção com arco interno nos aparelhos elétricos de média e alta tensão
column13: "mistura de hidrofluoro olefina e de hidrofluoro carboneto para melhorar a manutenção com arco interno nos aparelhos elétricos de média e alta-tensão". a presente invenção refere-se à utilização de uma mistura, compreendendo uma hidrofluoro olefina e um hidrofluoro carboneto, eventualmente associados a um outro gás fluorado e a um gás de diluição como meio de isolamento elétrico e/ou de extinção dos arcos elétricos em um aparelho elétrico de média tensão. a invenção refere-se também a um aparelho elétrico de média ou alta tensão, no qual o isolamento elétrico e/ou a extinção dos arcos elétricos é (são) assegurada (os) por essa mistura.

column12: Passive athermal fibre Bragg grating strain gage
column13: Fiber Bragg gratings (FBGs) are particular suitable for measuring strain. However, a single parameter measurement is difficult to implement, since cross-sensitivity to temperature compels the use of an additional temperature reference, e.g. a strain-inactive FBG. The development of a passive athermal fiber Bragg grating strain gage is thus of particular interest since it renders optional the measurement of temperature, benefiting large scale system design and performance. In view of this need, a package for fiber Bragg gratings (17) that enables strain measurements to be performed while canceling temperature sensitivity is disclosed. The proposed design is based on a structure composed of two parts (10,11), which can be made of the same material, having a defined length ratio (L 2 /L 1 ) that allows the adjustment of the temperature sensitivity to zero, providing athermal operation of the strain gage. Moreover, the disclosed passive athermal scheme is adjustable to further compensate for structural thermal expansion, enabling the load-induced strain component to be decoupled from the temperature-induced strain component.
column15: MOITAARAUJO FRANCISCO MANUEL;;DE ALMEIDA FERREIRA LUIS ALBER

column12: METHOD FOR THE PRODUCTION OF LOGOTYPES
column13: The present invention relates to a method for manufacturing logos, preferably applied in the automotive industry. This method comprises several stages starting with the logotype injection, followed by tampography of the inner side of the piece using tampography inks; after removal of any surface contamination, the pieces are placed inside the vacuum chamber in such a way that the areas exposed are only the ones intended to be coated by deposition and activation of the surface of the piece using plasma, and after the application of the metal the following techniques can be employed: in vacuum applying a SiOx Nitride layer of the metal; or using a water- or solvent-based protective paint with ultraviolet or thermal cure, or applying a second piece.

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR OPTIMIZING CODE FOR FIELD PROGRAMMABLE GATE ARRAYS
column13: A method for the generation of a hardware accelerator (20) is described. The method comprises inputting (110) a program (105) with a plurality of lines of code describing an algorithm to be implemented on the hardware accelerator (20) and generating (125) a dataflow graph in memory from the inputted program (105). The dataflow graph is optimized and an output program (140) created from the dataflow graph is output. The output program (140) is then provided to a high-level synthesis tool for generating the hardware accelerator (20).

column12: Ferramenta de dressagem e método para a produção da mesma
column13: ferramenta de dressagem e método para a produção da mesma. a invenção refere-se a uma ferramenta de dressagem que tem elementos perfilados (11.1, 11.2, 12.1, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4) que são dispostos coaxialmente uns aos outros e que são fornecidos cada um com uma forma de perfil, que é afunilada ou semelhante em sua seção transversal axial e tem superfícies de trabalho (13, 14) que são fornecidas com partículas de material duro. os elementos perfilados (11.1, 11.2, 12.1, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4) são delimitados em sua circunferência externa por pelo menos uma superfície gerada (23, 24). a ferramenta de dressagem (10) compreende seis elementos perfilados (11.1, 11.2, 12.1, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4) dispostos coaxialmente uns aos outros e um corpo principal metálico de uma ou duas partes (19) para toda a ferramenta de dressagem (10) ou para uma superfície gerada particular (23, 24). as formas de perfil com as partículas de material duro dos elementos perfilados (11.1, 11.2, 12.1, 12.2, 12.3, 12.4) são aqui produzidas por um processo negativo com um composto de fundição (15) aplicado ao corpo principal particular (19). esta ferramenta de dressagem pode, assim, ser usada para um perfilamento de sem-fins de retificação de forma extremamente produtiva e precisa e também de forma que possam ser corrigidos.

column12: CARRO DE COMPRAS PORTÁTIL
column13: O PRESENTE MODELO DE UTILIDADE REFERE-SE A UM DISPOSITIVO COMBINADO DE ARTICULAÇÃO E ABERTURA/FECHO PARA CARRO DE COMPRAS PORTÁTIL, COM UM CONJUNTO ARTICULADO DE TUBOS (1), UMA BASE DE SUSTENTAÇÃO EM MALHA RECTANGULAR APERTADA (2) COM VARÃO DE AÇO PROTEGIDO CONTRA CORROSÃO, UM SISTEMA DE LOCOMOÇÃO CONSTITUÍDO POR 4 RODAS DIRECCIONÁVEIS (3) CARACTERIZADO POR UM REVESTIMENTO EM LONA DESDOBRÁVEL (4) COM FECHO DE CORRER (5). O DITO CONJUNTO ARTICULADO PERMITE A FÁCIL MONTAGEM E DESMONTAGEM DO SISTEMA DE FORMA A QUE, QUANDO DESMONTADO, A SUA DIMENSÃO SEJA REDUZIDA E PERMITA A SUA PORTABILIDADE. ESTA INVENÇÃO TEM POR OBJECTIVO FACILITAR O TRANSPORTE DE OBJECTOS DESDE O LOCAL DE COMPRA ATÉ AO LOCAL DESTINO. O PRESENTE MODELO DE UTILIDADE É APLICÁVEL AO FABRICO DE SISTEMAS LOCOMOTIVOS DE TRANSPORTE DE VOLUMES.

column13: O PRESENTE MODELO DE UTILIDADE REFERE-SE A UM DISPOSITIVO COMBINADO DE ARTICULAÇÃO E ABERTURA/FECHO PARA CARRO DE COMPRAS PORTÁTIL, O QUAL COMPREENDE ESTRUTURA ARTICULADA DE TUBOS, UMA BASE DE SUSTENTAÇÃO EM MALHA RECTANGULAR APERTADA, UM SISTEMA DE LOCOMOÇÃO CONSTITUÍDO POR 4 RODAS E UM REVESTIMENTO DESDOBRÁVEL COM FECHO ÉCLAIR (FIG. 1). O DITO CONJUNTO ARTICULADO PERMITE A FÁCIL MONTAGEM E DESMONTAGEM DO SISTEMA DE FORMA A QUE, QUANDO DESMONTADO, A SUA DIMENSÃO SEJA REDUZIDA E PERMITA A SUA PORTABILIDADE. ESTA INVENÇÃO TEM POR OBJECTIVO FACILITAR O TRANSPORTE DE OBJECTOS DESDE O LOCAL DE COMPRA ATÉ AO LOCAL DESTINO. O PRESENTE MODELO DE UTILIDADE É APLICÁVEL AO FABRICO DE SISTEMAS LOCOMOTIVOS DE TRANSPORTE DE VOLUMES.

column13: A new and improved tunable optical receiver based on thermal optics and controllers for technologies that require fast wavelength channel tuning. column12: SISTEMA E MÉTODO DE MEDIÇÃO DO TEMPO DE VOO E LOCAL DE ATERRAGEM DE SALTOS EM TRAMPOLINS.
column13: A PRESENTE INVENÇÃO, REFERE-SE A UM SISTEMA E MÉTODO DE MEDIÇÃO DO TEMPO DE VOO E DESLOCAMENTO HORIZONTAL NUM TRAMPOLIM (1). O TRAMPOLIM (1) É CONSTITUÍDO POR UMA ESTRUTURA RÍGIDA (2), COMPOSTA POR UMA PARTE SUPERIOR (3) E POR UNS PÉS (4), UMA PLURALIDADE DE MOLAS (5) E UMA LONA FLEXÍVEL (6). UMA PLURALIDADE DE MÓDULOS EMISSORES (7) E MÓDULOS RECETORES/SENSORES (8) DE LUZ É MONTADA NA PARTE SUPERIOR (3) DA ESTRUTURA RÍGIDA (2) DO TRAMPOLIM (1). ANALISANDO TEMPORALMENTE OS DADOS DOS MÓDULOS RECETORES/SENSORES (8) DE LUZ AQUANDO DE UM SALTO NA LONA FLEXÍVEL (6), O MÓDULO DE PROCESSAMENTO CENTRAL (9) DETETA O LOCAL DE ATERRAGEM E O TEMPO ENTRE SAÍDA E ATERRAGEM NA LONA FLEXÍVEL (6) DE CADA SALTO EFETUADO. A PRESENTE INVENÇÃO PODE SER USADA EM CONTEXTO DE TREINO OU DE COMPETIÇÃO EM GINÁSTICA DE TRAMPOLINS ONDE OS PARÂMETROS REFERIDOS ACIMA SÃO RELEVANTES PARA A NOTA DOS ATLETAS.

column12: KNITTED NET FOR WRAPPING AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTS
column13: The present invention relates to a Raschel knitted net for wrapping agricultural products for packaging purposes, comprising a plurality of longitudinal warp strips with knitted meshes and a plurality of transverse weft strips, characterised in that the angle between the warp strips and the weft strips ranges from 40-0°, in particular: • the weft strips cross the warp strips every 8 knitted meshes of the warp strips, in the case of standard Raschel knitted nets, and/or • the successive weft strips cross the warp strips in the same knitted meshes of the warp strips. The knitted nets described herein can be used for wrapping agricultural products for packaging purposes, namely cylindrical bales, for example straw bales, fodder bales, bales of silage materials, cut maize, pressed pulp, shredded plastic waste or comminuted household waste.

column12: SYSTEM AND PROCESS TO ASSESS PHYSIOLOGICAL STATES OF PLANT TISSUES, IN VIVO AND/OR IN SITU, USING IMPEDANCE TECHNIQUES
column13: The present invention relates to a system for using in a process to assess physiological states of plant tissues, in vivo and/or in situ , using impedance techniques. This system is portable, minimally invasive and causing no damage to the plant. The invention relates also to a process to assess physiological states of plant tissues, in vivo and/or in situ , using impedance techniques and the system referred to in above, based on correlation between impedance data and/or impedance parameters and a physiological parameter. This process is applied, for example, to a tree, such as a pine tree.

column12: MULTI-FUNCTIONAL COLLECTOR FOR WASTE WATER
column13: The present invention relates to a compact multi-functional collector integrating screening, grit removal, a control system for the pumping system, an alternative passageway and automatic cleaning, for the collection of grey water from bathtubs or shower trays, in particular for sanitary equipment for the collection and reuse of grey water, and for continuous recirculation systems. The collector comprises a removable screen (5) for the removal of solids (fur, hair and soap fragments), a grit removal device (14) for sand removal, a system of multidirectional bottom injectors (12, 13) for cleaning the collector, a pump control system comprising level probes (24 and 24'), the minimum level probe being placed at the upper edge of the water suction slot (11) in order to ensure that the pumping system is always under a hydraulic load (primed), a drainage stabilizing system consisting of a metal attachment screen (7) connecting the collector to the bathtub / shower tray in a watertight manner and damping turbulent drainage to laminar drainage, and an alternative passageway (16) which ensures a direct connection to the waste water system (1) and simultaneously deactivates the pumping system. The present invention is designed for sanitary appliances and equipment for reusing and recirculating water, and for rationalizing water consumption.

column12: A circuit breaker mechanism
column13: A circuit breaker mechanism is provided with a U-shaped tripping lever which has a base (10) and first (12) and second (14) parallel legs. The tripping lever is arranged around a magnetic frame of an electromagnetic tripping device and is mounted by pivot points (28, 32) which coincide with the pivot axis of a pivotable armature of the tripping device. On one leg (14) is an outwardly extending projection (30) while on the other leg (12) is a complementary cavity (34). A number of circuit breakers can be assembled side-by-side, with the projection (30) on the tripping lever of a first circuit breaker engaging the cavity (34) in the tripping lever of an adjacent circuit breaker. Thus, when one circuit breaker is tripped, the others are tripped together with it. <IMAGE>

column12: Textured work roll for a metal substrate
column13: A textured work roll can impart a desired texture on a metal substrate, such as an aluminum or aluminum alloy sheet. The textured work roll can be used for applying a gloss finish on the metal substrate. The textured work roll can be textured by grinding the work roll to form a ground work roll; electro-discharge texturing the work roll to form an electro-discharge textured work roll; and polishing the work roil to form a polished work roil. The polished work can have an Ra value between 0.30 mu m and 0.70 mu m. The polished work roll can be used to apply the gloss finish on the metal substrate.

column12: Circuit breaker housing
column13: A modular housing for a circuit breaker has first and second opposed side panels which engage one another at respective upper and lower edges defined by transversely extending flanges. The mated flanges define the upper and lower edges of the housing. When assembled, the side panels define an enclosure with front and rear openings, with grooves on the inner edges of the openings which receive tongues of respective modular front and rear panels of the circuit breaker housing. The front panel has an opening through which an operating lever protrudes when the housing is assembled, and the operating lever pivots on formations on the inner surfaces of the side panels. The modular construction of the circuit breaker housing allows different front and rear panels to be fitted to a common shell. For example, a range of circuit breakers having different operating handles and different terminal configurations can be provided at a relatively low cost. <IMAGE>
column15: LEET EDWARD;;RIBEIRO MANUEL FERNANDO VIDAL;;FERREIRA CARLOS ALBERTO

column12: Passive athermal fiber bragg grating strain gage
column13: Fiber Bragg gratings (FBGs) are particular suitable for measuring strain. However, a single parameter measurement is difficult to implement, since cross-sensitivity to temperature compels the use of an additional temperature reference, e.g. a strain-inactive FBG. The development of a passive athermal fiber Bragg grating strain gage is thus of particular interest since it renders optional the measurement of temperature, benefiting large scale system design and performance. In view of this need, a package for fiber Bragg gratings that enables strain measurements to be performed while canceling temperature sensitivity is disclosed. The proposed design is based on a structure composed of two parts, which can be made of the same material, having a defined length ratio that allows the adjustment of the temperature sensitivity to zero, providing athermal operation of the strain gage. Moreover, the disclosed passive athermal scheme is adjustable to further compensate for structural thermal expansion, enabling the load-induced strain component to be decoupled from the temperature-induced strain component.

column12: Crystal ballot box, has multilaminar translucent crystal faces connected to sensors that detect presence of human beings or variation of environmental conditions, and camcorders and image projectors incorporated in pedestal
column13: The box has an apt hollow polyhedron hermetically closed to contain a body or object with transparent or multilaminar translucent crystal faces. The multilaminar translucent crystal faces are equipped between laminae with polarizeable liquid using electrical current. The multilaminar translucent crystal faces are connected to luminance ray sensors. The sensors detect the presence of human beings or variation of environmental conditions. Camcorders, image projectors, and a computer science equipment are incorporated in a pedestal.

column12: Rocking mechanism
column13: The presented invention concerns a rocking device that includes a drive mechanism (11,13,14,15) which actuates with an alternative motion one end of an elastic cord (3, 12), which, through its other end, impairs the alternative motion to a carrying handle or any other equivalent attachment point (2) of a baby chair or support or carrying for youngsters (babies) (1), that is adequate for that purpose, being the drive mechanism (11,13,14,15) and the elastic cord (3,12) associated in such a way that, by adjusting its motor (14) idle speed, the frequency of the inducer movement adjusts itself to the natural frequency of the movement induced on the baby chair or support device with the baby. In an alternative version of the invention the rocking device is attached to the baby chair or support device (1) and the elastic cord (3, 12) is fixed to an external attachment point (17).

column12: METHOD AND SYSTEM FOR MEDIA CHANNEL FORMAT SET MANAGEMENT IN OPTICAL TRANSPORT NETWORKS
column13: Disclosed herein is a method of determining a set of media channel (MCh) widths to be used in an optical network, comprising the following steps: based on the topology of the network, computing a first set of MCh widths for tentative use in said optical network, said first set of MCh width defining a target spectral efficiency, and generating a reduced set of MCh widths from said first set of MCh widths by mapping each of the original MCh widths of said first set to a corresponding new MCh width, which is identical with or larger than the original MCh width. The mapping is carried out automatically using a width adjustment module (18) module employing an optimization algorithm that penalizes MCh widths that are more likely to cause fragmentation problems in the spectrum as compared to MCh widths that are less likely to cause fragmentation problems, and penalizes a decrease in spectral width as compared to the target spectral efficiency due to the mapping of an original MCh width of said first set to a new, larger width.

column12: CIRCUIT BREAKER HOUSING
column13: A modular housing for a circuit breaker has first and second opposed side panels which engage one another at respective upper and lower edges defined by transversely extending flanges. The mated flanges define the upper and lower edges of the housing. When assembled, the side panels define an enclosure with front and rear openings, with grooves on the inner edges of the openings which receive tongues of respective modular front and rear panels of the circuit breaker housing. The front panel has an opening through which an operating lever protrudes when the housing is assembled, and the operating lever pivots on formations on the inner surfaces of the side panels. The modular construction of the circuit breaker housing allows different front and rear panels to be fitted to a common shell. For example, a range of circuit breakers having different operating handles and different terminal configurations can be provided at a relatively low cost.
column15: LEET EDWARD;;RIBEIRO MANUEL FERNANDO VIDAL;;FERREIRA CARLOS ALBERTO

column12: 금속 기판을 위한 텍스쳐링된 작업 롤
column13: 텍스쳐링된 작업 롤은 알루미늄 또는 알루미늄 합금 시트와 같은 금속 기판 상에 원하는 텍스쳐를 부여할 수 있다. 텍스쳐링된 작업 롤은 금속 기판 상에 광택 마감을 적용하기 위해 사용될 수 있다. 텍스쳐링된 작업 롤은 작업 롤을 그라인딩하여 그라인딩된 작업 롤을 형성하고; 작업 롤을 방전 텍스쳐링하여 방전 텍스쳐링된 작업 롤을 형성하고; 작업 롤을 연마하여 연마된 작업 롤을 형성함으로써 텍스쳐링될 수 있다. 연마된 작업 롤은 0.30 ㎛ 내지 0.70 ㎛의 Ra 값을 가질 수 있다. 연마된 작업 롤은 금속 기판 상에 광택 마감을 적용하기 위해 사용될 수 있다.

column12: ROCKING MECHANISM.
column13: The hereby presented invention concerns a rocking device that includes a drive mechanism (11,13,14,15) which actuates with an alternative motion one end of an elastic cord (3, 12), which, through its other end, impairs the alternative motion to a carrying handle or any other equivalent attachment point (2) of a baby chair or support or carrying for youngsters (babies) (1), that is adequate for that purpose, being the drive mechanism (11,13,14,15) and the elastic cord (3,12) associated in such a way that, by adjusting its motor (14) idle speed, the frequency of the inducer movement adjusts itself to the natural frequency of the movement induced on the baby chair or support device with the baby. In an alternative version of the invention the rocking device is attached to the baby chair or support device (1) and the elastic cord (3, 12) is fixed to an external attachment point (17).

column12: TEXTURED WORK ROLL FOR A METAL SUBSTRATE
column13: A textured work roll can impart a desired texture on a metal substrate, such as an aluminum or aluminum alloy sheet. The textured work roll can be used for applying a gloss finish on the metal substrate. The textured work roll can be textured by grinding the work roll to form a ground work roll; electro-discharge texturing the work roll to form an electro-discharge textured work roll; and polishing the work roil to form a polished work roil. The polished work can have an Ra value between 0.30 µm and 0.70 µm. The polished work roll can be used to apply the gloss finish on the metal substrate.
column15: XAVIER RENATO RUFINO;;CARVALHO FRANCISCO;;FERREIRA ADRIANO MANUEL POVOA

column12: MULTIFUNCTION CONSTRUCTION MACHINE.
column13: Engin de chantier multifonctions destiné aux chantiers de constructions civiles et de travaux publics. L'engin regroupe, sur un même châssis automoteur, une bétonnière (20) avec un ensemble d'outils d'un côté, comprenant une pelle chargeuse (60), une pelle niveleuse (70) et une pelle excavatrice (80) et de l'autre côté un tombereau basculant ou dumper (50). La bétonnière est à cuve fixe équipée d'un malaxeur tournant (33), un couvercle articulé (25) étant adapté à former une goulotte de transfert du contenu de la pelle chargeuse dans le tombereau.

column12: método para texturizar um rolo laminador, rolo laminador, produto, e, tira de metal
column13: trata-se de um rolo laminador texturizado que pode transmitir uma textura desejada em um substrato de metal, tal como uma chapa de alumínio ou de liga de alumínio. o rolo laminador texturizado pode ser usado para aplicar um acabamento lustroso no substrato de metal. o rolo laminador texturizado pode ser texturizado esmerilhando-se o rolo laminador para formar um rolo laminador esmerilhado; texturizando-se por eletroerosão o rolo laminador para formar um rolo laminador texturizado por eletroerosão; e polindo-se o rolo laminador para formar um rolo laminador polido. o trabalho polido pode ter um valor de ra entre 0,30 µm e 0,70 µm. o rolo laminador polido pode ser usado para aplicar o acabamento lustroso no substrato de metal.

column12: URNA DE CRISTAL TRANSPARENTE POLARIZABLE ACTIVABLE POR SENSORES.
column13: Urna de cristal transparente polarizable activable por sensores esencialmente caracterizada por ser un poliedro hueco herméticamente cerrado apto para contener un cuerpo u otro objeto destinado a su exposición con caras de cristal transparente o translúcido multilaminares dotadas entre sus láminas de un líquido polarizable por una corriente eléctrica que lo transforme en opaco, translúcido o transparente, permitiendo en su caso la visión del interior o su ocultación y conectada a sensores de rayos infrarrojos, lumínicos o de otro tipo, que detecten la presencia de seres humanos u otras condiciones físicas definidas, de forma que la presencia humana o la variación de las condiciones ambientales active automáticamente mediante los sensores la opacidad o transparencia de los cristales polarizables y la visión u ocultación del interior por reacción al medio, pudiendo incorporar cámaras de vídeo, proyectores de imágenes sobre la urna, un equipo informático y otros aparatos en su pedestal.

column12: TEXTURED WORKING ROLL FOR METAL BASE
column13: FIELD: technological processes.SUBSTANCE: invention relates to the field of rolling. Textured working roll is configured to impart a metal substrate, such as a sheet of aluminum or an aluminum alloy, to a given texture. Textured working roll can be used for gloss finishing of the metal base. Exclusion of probability of cracks formation on rolled sheet is provided due to that roller can be textured by grinding of working roll to obtain ground working roll, electrosparking texturing of working roll to produce electrosparked textured working roll and to polish working roll to produce polished working roll. Polished working roll has Ra value between 0.30 mcm and 0.70 mcm.EFFECT: textured working roll for metal base is proposed.10 cl, 11 dwg

column12: PADDING METHOD FOR CONVOLUTIONAL NEURAL NETWORK LAYERS ADAPTED TO PERFORM MULTIVARIATE TIME SERIES ANALYSIS
column13: The present invention is enclosed in the field of Convolutional Neural Networks configured to perform Multivariate Time Series analysis, and relates to a padding method specially conceived for configuring convolutional neural network layers adapted to perform Multivariate Time Series analysis on a bidimensional input map (1). The padding method involves mapping the input map (1) onto a cylinder (2) by adding a predefined number of wrapped rows, depending on the vertical size of the convolutional kernel (3) to be used in the subsequent convolutional operation.

column12: DOSING DEVICE OF A SERVICE LIQUID FOR A FLUSHING TANK, AND FLUSHING TANK PROVIDED WITH SUCH A DOSING DEVICE
column13: A dosing device (5) for dosing a service liquid in a water stream discharged from a flushing tank, comprises: a reservoir (21) for a service liquid; a dosing chamber (22) communicating with the reservoir (21) for receiving a dose of service liquid from the reservoir (21) through an opening (30); a movable piston (23) housed in the dosing chamber (22) and operated by an expandable bellows (24); a water supply pipe (25), connectable to a filling valve (3) of the tank (1) for feeding water to the bellows (24) so as to expand the bellows (24) and consequently move the piston (23) in the chamber and push service liquid from the dosing chamber (22) into a delivery pipe (26) of service liquid connectable to an overflow pipe (15) of the tank (1).
column15: MATOS VIEIRA HELDER MANUEL;;FERREIRA DA COSTA VÍTOR ANTÓNIO

column12: MÉTODO DE INTERAÇÃO PARA CONTEÚDOS REMOTOS EM MOLDURAS DIGITAIS
column13: ESTA INVENÇÃO CONSISTE NUM MÉTODO QUE PERMITE INTERAÇÃO ARBITRÁRIA COM CONTEÚDO REMOTO, EXIBIDO NA MOLDURA DIGITAL, USANDO APENAS OS BOTÕES DE AVANÇAR E RECUAR DISPONÍVEIS NA GENERALIDADE DAS MOLDURAS DIGITAIS EXISTENTES NO MERCADO.ESTA INVENÇÃO PERMITE AUMENTAR O NÚMERO POTENCIAL DE FUNÇÕES DE UMA MOLDURA DIGITAL COMO DISPOSITIVO GENÉRICO DE INTERAÇÃO COM CONTEÚDOS PERSONALIZADOS. NAS MOLDURAS DIGITAIS COM LIGAÇÃO À REDE, AS IMAGENS EXIBIDAS PODEM SER OBTIDAS A PARTIR DE UM QUALQUER SERVIÇO REMOTO E NÃO PRECISAM DE SER NECESSARIAMENTE FOTOGRAFIAS. COM UM SERVIÇO DE GESTÃO DE CONTEÚDOS ADEQUADO, PODE-SE GERAR DINAMICAMENTE A SEQUÊNCIA DE IMAGENS QUE SE PRETENDA E CADA IMAGEM PODE TER UM QUALQUER TIPO DE INFORMAÇÃO QUE SEJA RELEVANTE PARA O MOMENTO, TRANSFORMANDO ASSIM A MOLDURA DE FOTOGRAFIAS DIGITAL NUM DISPOSITIVO GENÉRICO DE APRESENTAÇÃO DE INFORMAÇÃO PERSONALIZADA. ESTA INVENÇÃO PERMITE ATRIBUIR NOVAS SEMÂNTICAS DE CONTROLO DA APRESENTAÇÃO E SELEÇÃO DE CONTEÚDOS AOS COMANDOS DA MOLDURA DIGITAL.
column15: JOSÉ RUI JO O PEIXOTO;;LOPES CARLOS MANUEL FERREIRA

column12: MULTI-CONVOLUTIONAL ATTENTION UNIT FOR MULTIVARIABLE TIME SERIES ANALYSIS
column13: The present invention relates to attention mechanisms applicable to perform Multivariable Time-Series analysis using Recurrent Neural Networks. It is developed a multi-convolutional attention unit which is able to generate one independent attention vector per variable of Multivariable Time-Series input data (1), using one-dimensional convolutional operations to capture the importance of a time-step inside a sub-pattern. For that purpose, the attention unit comprises a splinting block (2), a attention block (3), a concatenation block (4) and a scaling block (5).
column15: PEREIRA GONÇALVES RUI JORGE;;FERREIRA LOBO PEREIRA FERNANDO MANUEL

column12: Athermal fiber bragg grating strain gauge
column13: Fiber Bragg gratings are particularly suitable for measuring strain. Currently such a single parameter measurement is difficult to implement, since cross-sensitivity to temperature compels the use of an additional temperature reference - e.g., strain-inactive fiber Bragg grating. A passive athermal fiber Bragg grating strain gauge would render unnecessary the measurement of temperature. In line with this, a gauge design for fiber Bragg gratings that enables strain measurements to be performed while canceling temperature sensitivity is disclosed. The proposed design is based on a structure (2, 3) optionally composed of a single material that defines a length ratio that allows the adjustment of the temperature sensitivity of the fiber Bragg grating (1) to zero, providing athermal operation of the strain gauge. In a further embodiment, the proposed passive athermal scheme can be designed to also compensate for structural material thermal expansion, enabling load-induced strain-components to be measured.
column14: FIBERSENSING SIST S AVANCADOS DE MONITORIZACAO S A

column12: ROCKING MECHANISM
column13: The hereby presented invention concerns a rocking device that includes a drive mechanism (11,13,14,15) which actuates with an alternative motion one end of an elastic cord (3, 12), which, through its other end, impairs the alternative motion to a carrying handle or any other equivalent attachment point (2) of a baby chair or support or carrying for youngsters (babies) (1), that is adequate for that purpose, being the drive mechanism (11,13,14,15) and the elastic cord (3,12) associated in such a way that, by adjusting its motor (14) idle speed, the frequency of the inducer movement adjusts itself to the natural frequency of the movement induced on the baby chair or support device with the baby. In an alternative version of the invention the rocking device is attached to the baby chair or support device (1) and the elastic cord (3, 12) is fixed to an external attachment point (17).

column12: PADDING METHOD FOR CONVOLUTIONAL NEURAL NETWORK LAYERS PERFORMING MULTIVARIATE TIME SERIES ANALYSIS
column13: PADDING METHOD FOR CONVOLUTIONAL NEURAL NETWORK LAYERS PERFORMING MULTIVARIATE TIME SERIES ANALYSIS THE PRESENT INVENTION IS ENCLOSED IN THE FIELD OF CONVOLUTIONAL NEURAL NETWORKS CONFIGURED TO PERFORM MULTIVARIATE TIME SERIES ANALYSIS, AND RELATES TO A PADDING METHOD SPECIALLY CONCEIVED FOR CONFIGURING CONVOLUTIONAL NEURAL NETWORK LAYERS ADAPTED TO PERFORM MULTIVARIATE TIME SERIES ANALYSIS ON A BIDIMENSIONAL INPUT MAP (1). THE PADDING METHOD INVOLVES MAPPING THE INPUT MAP (1) ONTO A CYLINDER (2) BY ADDING A PREDEFINED NUMBER OF WRAPPED ROWS, DEPENDING ON THE VERTICAL SIZE OF THE CONVOLUTIONAL KERNEL (3) TO BE USED IN THE SUBSEQUENT CONVOLUTIONAL OPERATION.

column12: UNIDADE DE ATENÇÃO MULTI-CONVOLUCIONAL PARA ANÁLISE DE SÉRIES TEMPORAIS MULTIVARIÁVEL
column13: A PRESENTE INVENÇÃO DIZ RESPEITO A MECANISMOS DE ATENÇÃO APLICÁVEIS PARA DESEMPENHAR A ANÁLISE DE SÉRIES TEMPORAIS MULTIVARIÁVEL UTILIZANDO REDES NEURONAIS RECORRENTES. É DESENVOLVIDA UMA UNIDADE DE ATENÇÃO MULTI-CONVOLUCIONAL QUE É CAPAZ DE GERAR UM VECTOR DE ATENÇÃO INDEPENDENTE POR CADA VARIÁVEL DE DADOS DE ENTRADA DE SÉRIES TEMPORAIS MULTIVARIÁVEL (1), UTILIZANDO OPERAÇÕES CONVOLUCIONAIS UNI-DIMENSIONAIS PARA CAPTURAR A IMPORTÂNCIA DE UMA ETAPA TEMPORAL DENTRO DE UM SUBPADRÃO. PARA TAL PROPÓSITO, A UNIDADE DE ATENÇÃO COMPREENDE UM BLOCO DE CONTENÇÃO (2), UM BLOCO DE ATENÇÃO (3), UM BLOCO DE CONCATENAÇÃO (4) E UM BLOCO DE ESCALONAMENTO (5).

column12: sistema integrado de dispositivos interativos , com dispositivo de sensoriamento e minimização de efeito memória embarcado, aplicado em equipamentos operados por um ou múltiplos usuários
column13: SISTEMA INTEGRADO DE DISPOSITIVOS INTERATIVOS, COM DISPOSITIVO DE SENSORIAMENTO E MINIMIZAçãO DE EFEITO MEMóRIA EM- BARCADO, APLICADO EM EQUIPAMENTOS OPERADOS POR UM OU MúLTIPLOS USUáRIOS, representado por uma solução inventiva traduzida na forma de um equipamento de visualização de imagens, notadamente visualização em dois planos, através de uma tela na posição horizontal, sensível ao toque das mãos, com capacidade de captura de até centenas de comandos simultâneos, passíveis de serem interpretados pelo computador de forma dinâmica e com latências abaixo da percepção humana. Com estas características abrem-se novas possibilidades para o desenvolvimento de aplicativos computacionais interpretadores de múltiplos eventos em telas, viabilizando-se interações colaborativas de grupos de pessoas no mesmo equipamento. A proximidade física entre estas pessoas com comunicação direta entre elas, somada a recursos de interatividade direta com as mãos no equipamento com o sistema integrado embarcado deverá ser um novo paradigma de interação homem máquina, abrindo-se potenciais de aprendizado e criatividade acima da tradicional computação pessoal.

column12: SISTEMA E MÉTODO PARA RECEPÇÃO E APRESENTAÇÃO DE INFORMAÇÃO NOTICIOSA EM EQUIPAMENTOS TERMINAIS MÓVEIS NO ESTADO PASSIVO, CUSTEADA POR PUBLICIDADE
column13: A presente invenção descreve um sistema que permite a apresentação de informação noticiosa, ou qualquer outro tipo de informação, de uma forma em que o custo de aquisição, processamento e transmissão da informação apresentada possa ser custeada em parte ou na totalidade por receitas provenientes de publicidade. No contexto de terminais móveis, este sistema permite que sempre que o dispositivo não esteja em uso, este possa ser utilizado para recolher e apresentar informação e publicidade para o utilizador.

column12: DISPOSITIVO DE DISTRIBUIÇÃO DE GÁS PARA UM QUEIMADOR DE GÁS ATMOSFÉRICO
column13: O PRESENTE PEDIDO DESCREVE UM DISPOSITIVO DE DISTRIBUIÇÃO DE GÁS (100) PARA UM QUEIMADOR DE GÁS ATMOSFÉRICO, O QUAL COMPREENDE UM INVÓLUCRO DE DISPOSITIVO DE DISTRIBUIÇÃO (110) COM UMA CONEXÃO DE ENTRADA DE GÁS (180) E COM PELO MENOS UM INJETOR (150) CONCEBIDO NUMA PAREDE DIANTEIRA (120) DO INVÓLUCRO DE DISPOSITIVO DE DISTRIBUIÇÃO (110) E CONECTADO COM A CONEXÃO DE ENTRADA DE GÁS (180) ATRAVÉS DE UM CANAL DE ENTRADA DE GÁS. O PRESENTE PEDIDO DIVULGA UM CONCEITO DE QUEIMADOR, O QUAL APRESENTA UM FATOR DE AR PRIMÁRIO SUFICIENTEMENTE ELEVADO E ALÉM DISSO PERMITE UMA MISTURA MELHORADA DO GÁS COMBUSTÍVEL E DO AR DE COMBUSTÃO.

column12: SISTEMA DE POUPANÇA DE ÁGUA PARA CONSUMO DOMÉSTICO
column13: O PRESENTE INVENTO DIZ RESPEITO A UM SISTEMA DE POUPANÇA DE ÁGUA PARA CONSUMO DOMÉSTICO QUE COMPREENDE UMA VÁLVULA DE 3 VIAS TERMOESTÁTICA, MONTADA NUM CIRCUITO DETUBAGENS, QUE PERMITE QUE A ÁGUA COM UMA TEMPERATURA INFERIOR À TEMPERATURA PREDETERMINADA RETORNE AO REFERIDO CIRCUITO DE TUBAGENS PARA SER AQUECIDA NUM TERMOACUMULADOR, SEM QUE OCORRA DESPERDÍCIO DE ÁGUA COM TEMPERATURAS INFERIORES À TEMPERATURA PREDETERMINADA. DEVIDO ÀS CARACTERÍSTICAS, ANTERIORMENTE MENCIONADAS, O SISTEMA DEPOUPANÇA DE ÁGUA PARA CONSUMO DOMÉSTICO, TAMBÉM VAI CONTRIBUIR PARA UMA REDUÇÃO DA ENERGIA ELÉCTRICA CONSUMIDA PELO TERMOACUMULADOR. QUANDO ÁGUA QUE CIRCULA NO CIRCUITO DE TUBAGENS ESTÁ A UMA TEMPERATURA INFERIOR À TEMPERATURA PREDETERMINADA, RETORNA AO CIRCUITO DE TUBAGENS PARA SER REAQUECIDA.

column12: System and method for network access without reconfiguration
column13: A system and method for providing client access to a network without changing client network settings includes determining whether the client is configured to use a proxy service and selectively acting as the proxy service when the client is so configured. In one embodiment, determining whether the client is configured to use a proxy service includes establishing a connection between the client and a configuration manager and monitoring the connection for messages containing a proxy request.

column12: REATOR DE OXIDAÇÃO AUTO-CÍCLICO COM INVERSÃO PERIÓDICA DE FLUXO
column13: A PRESENTE REALIZAÇÃO CONSISTE NUM SISTEMA CATALÍTICO CONSTITUÍDO POR UM REATOR DE OXIDAÇÃO ACOPLADO A UM CONJUNTO DE VÁLVULAS AUTOMÁTICAS, PARA A UTILIZAÇÃO EM REAÇÕES DE OXIDAÇÃO, TAIS COMO REFORMAÇÃO AUTOTÉRMICA OU OXIDAÇÃO PARCIAL. O REATOR DE OXIDAÇÃO, NOMEADAMENTE, O REATOR DE OXIDAÇÃO CATALÍTICA, PODE SER INCORPORADO A UM SISTEMA DE OUTROS REATORES, OU SER UTILIZADO EXCLUSIVAMENTE, CONSOANTE A APLICAÇÃO. O REATOR DE OXIDAÇÃO CATALÍTICA (1) APRESENTA UMA CONFIGURAÇÃO DE TUBOS CONCÊNTRICOS (3, 4) E COMPREENDE PELO MENOS DOIS LEITOS DE REGENERAÇÃO (5), A MONTANTE E A JUSANTE DE UM LEITO CATALÍTICO (6). O EFLUENTE GASOSO A TRATAR É DIRECIONADO PARA O REATOR DE OXIDAÇÃO ATRAVÉS DE UM CONJUNTO DE VÁLVULAS (2) CONTROLADAS ATRAVÉS DE UM QUADRO DE CONTROLO GERAL. ESTE SISTEMA CATALÍTICO PERMITIRÁ AUMENTAR A EFICIÊNCIA ENERGÉTICA DAS REAÇÕES EXOTÉRMICAS, TORNANDO-AS AUTOTÉRMICAS.
column15: SERGIO MANUEL CASTRO SILVA;;ROSA MARIA DE OLIVEIRA QUINTA FERREIRA

column12: MÉTODO PARA A REDUÇÃO DA ACIDEZ E DA ACIDEZ VOLÁTIL EM VINHOS E OUTRAS BEBIDAS, FERMENTADAS OU NÃO
column13: A PRESENTE INVENÇÃO PERTENCE AO DOMÍNIO TÉCNICO DAS TECNOLOGIAS DE PROCESSAMENTO DE PRODUTOS AGRO-ALIMENTARES, E ABORDA UM MÉTODO PARA REDUZIR A ACIDEZ VOLÁTIL EM VINHOS E OUTRAS BEBIDAS, NOMEADAMENTE ATRAVÉS DA UTILIZAÇÃO DE OSMOSE INVERSA (1) E ELECTRODIÁLISE (3). APLICANDO ESTE MÉTODO, POR EXEMPLO, A UM VINHO, MOSTO OU MOSTO PARCIALMENTE FERMENTADO (ΑLFA), QUE TENHA SIDO PROPOSITADAMENTE SUBMETIDO A UM PRÉ-TRATAMENTO DE ACETIFICAÇÃO BIOLÓGICA CONTROLADA, OU SUBMETIDO HIDRÓLISE ENZIMÁTICA CONTROLADA, OBTÉM-SE UMA BEBIDA (ΒETA), ISENTA DE AROMAS NEFASTOS, E PRESERVANDO TODAS AS CARACTERÍSTICAS ORGANOLÉTICAS ORIGINAIS. UM VINHO OU OUTRA BEBIDA PODE ADQUIRIR ACIDEZ VOLÁTIL DEVIDO AO CRESCIMENTO NATURAL OU PROPOSITADO DE BACTÉRIAS ACÉTICAS OU OUTROS MICRORGANISMOS, NOMEADAMENTE DO GÉNERO ACETOBACTER, FICANDO ENTÃO ALTERADO DO PONTO DE VISTA ORGANOLÉTICO. ISSO DEVE-SE AO SEU ENRIQUECIMENTO EM VÁRIOS TIPOS DE SUBSTÂNCIAS AROMÁTICAS, ALGUMAS DE BOAS CARACTERÍSTICAS (CARÁCTER BALSÂMICO, FLORAL) E OUTRAS DE CARACTERÍSTICAS NEFASTAS, POSSUINDO SABORES E AROMAS ACÉTICOS E PUNGENTES. PELA REMOÇÃO DOS SABORES E AROMAS ACÉTICOS E PUNGENTES, PELO MÉTODO DESCRITO NESTA INVENÇÃO, PERMANECEM OS BONS AROMAS LATENTES, QUE BENEFICIAM O VINHO SENSORIALMENTE. AS UTILIZAÇÕES PRINCIPAIS DESTE MÉTODO SÃO: REDUÇÃO DA ACIDEZ VOLÁTIL EM VINHOS, MOSTOS, CERVEJA, CIDRA, E OUTRAS BEBIDAS FERMENTADAS OU NÃO,

column12: célula portátil de dispositivos interativos para múltiplos usuários
column13: CéLULA PORTáTIL DE DISPOSITIVOS INTERATIVOS PARA MúLTIPLOS USUáRIOS. Constitui-se de uma embalagem, tipo caixote, resistente ao transporte com guias lineares, mecanismos de neutralização de peso e impacto e dispositivos de travamento na qual ficam acondicionados equipamentos que proporcionem o máximo de aproveitamento e interatividade a um número de até oito usuários por meio de características eletro-eletrónicas, mecânicas, computacionais, áticas e ergonómicas, formando uma célula modular portátil capaz de ser configurada para conter uma mesa de trabalho ergonómica com computadores portáteis (laptops) integrados (A); uma mesa interativa sensível ao toque com ergonomia para facilitar o acesso pelos usuários (E) conjugada, ou não, com um projetor e uma tela de projeção sobre a mesa (F), ou uma tela vertical conjugada com computador, projetor e câmeras para captação de imagem para interação dos usuários com as imagens da tela e as projetadas (J). O equipamento é construído de forma a ser facilmente transportado e montado, pois já possui pré- instaladas conexões de energia e lógica (rede), necessitando unicamente uma fonte de força e uma de dados para sua instalação, e um programa de suporte de monitoramento e controle, que possibilita a assistência técnica e a correção de defeitos à distância. Pode também ser utilizado de forma a integrar duas células com configurações distintas para uso conjugado (K e L).
